Vulnerability.Title: mdadm bug fix update
Vulnerability.Description: The mdadm packages contain a utility for creating, managing, and monitoring Linux multiple disk (MD) devices. This update fixes the following bugs: Previously, the mdadm utility did not detect and assemble Intel Matrix Storage Manager (IMSM) RAIDs on NVME controllers correctly. With this update, IMSM RAID arrays on NVME controllers are assembled as expected. (BZ#1173504) Previously, on a system installed on an Intel Matrix Storage Manager (IMSM) RAID, the migration record was not always cleared after a successful reshape. Now, the migration record is cleared correctly upon the reshape completion. (BZ#1183724) Previously, on a system with a RAID1 array, after attempting to resize the array to a fixed size beyond the 2-TB limit, the attempt was ignored. With this update, the reshape works as expected in the described situation. (BZ#1236538) Previously, on a system with an IMSM RAID array, running the "mdadm -Ss" command did not always stop the array correctly and left the array in a partially assembled state. With this update, "mdadm -Ss" stops the array correctly. (BZ#1263205) Users of mdadm are advised to upgrade to these updated packages, which fix these bugs. Note for remediation: Please disable the SELinux for RHEL 4/5 when repairing, or some rpm packages will fail to install.
